info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 6:34PM EDT until July 15 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
FFWPHI
The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Kent County in central Delaware... Northwestern Sussex County in southern Delaware...
* Until 1045 PM EDT.
* At 634 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas.
* Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Milford, Bridgeville, Ellendale, Andrewsville, Greenwood and Farmington.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Cedar Creek NANTICOKE, Mispillion River BROADKILL-SMYRNA, Jones Mill Branch NANTICOKE, West Branch Gum Branch NANTICOKE, Number One, Prong NANTICOKE, Parker Branch NANTICOKE, Owens Branch NANTICOKE, Marshyhope Creek NANTICOKE, Round Pole Branch BROADKILL-SMYRNA, Smith-Short and Willin Ditch NANTICOKE, BROADKILL-SMYRNA, Polk Branch NANTICOKE, Church Branch BROADKILL-SMYRNA, Deep Branch BROADKILL-SMYRNA, Ingram Branch BROADKILL-SMYRNA, Cedar Creek BROADKILL-SMYRNA, Mifflin Ditch NANTICOKE, Gravelly Branch NANTICOKE, Nanticoke River NANTICOKE, Grubby Neck Branch NANTICOKE, Sowbridge Branch BROADKILL-SMYRNA, Gully Camp Ditch NANTICOKE, Cart Branch NANTICOKE, Dutton Ditch BROADKILL-SMYRNA, Number Two, Prong NANTICOKE, Deep Creek NANTICOKE, Prospect Branch NANTICOKE, Quarter Branch NANTICOKE, White Marsh Branch NANTICOKE and Broadkill River BROADKILL-SMYRNA.
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
